description: Master tag taxonomy for portfolio projects. Tags are used for: 1) filtering on work.html, 2) finding related projects via similarity

medium.note: photography = photographic works as main medium

technology.note: audio = sound/audio works. 3d = 3D printing or 3D modeling. AI = AI-generated content

gaming.note: gaming = about video game culture, players, gaming as subject. gamebook = interactive book genre. Specific game names are separate tags. Use #interactive for works that are played (D&D sessions, participatory)

actors_performance.note: actors = physical performance. voice = voice acting/narration. motion-capture = mocap. talk = lectures/presentations

narrative.note: narrative = storytelling/narrative content. text = physical written text as part of work (newspapers, labels, etc). Use #voice for spoken narration

themes.note: player tag refers to projects about gaming and player experience. childhood for works about childhood memories/experiences. literature for literary adaptations/references. theory for theoretical/academic work. speculative for speculative/alternative futures

format_context.note: collaboration tag indicates co-created projects (not solo). interactive for participatory/interactive works. public-space for works in outdoor/public urban spaces. workshop for teaching/educational sessions

deprecated_tags.oneday: Removed - use date metadata instead (start/end same day)
deprecated_tags.game: Renamed to 'gaming' for clarity (about gaming culture, not playing)
deprecated_tags.game/map: Removed - use 'gaming' for works about game maps
deprecated_tags.game/cosmetics: Removed - use 'gaming' for works about in-game items
deprecated_tags.game/indie: Removed - use 'gaming' for indie game contexts
deprecated_tags.game/book: Renamed to 'gamebook' (single word for the genre)

filter_mapping.description: How tags/metadata map to work.html filters

tag_relationships.description: Semantic relationships between tags for similarity scoring

usage_guidelines.per_project: Use 3-7 tags per project for optimal specificity
usage_guidelines.hierarchical_tags: Use specific tags (e.g., audio/spatial) when applicable, general tags (audio) when not
usage_guidelines.game_names: Always include specific game names when project focuses on that game
usage_guidelines.new_tags: New tags should be proposed via build script and reviewed before adding to master list
